snippet: Sales were again led by Spain, up 26.1 percent from October 2013, helped by incentives. Among major European markets, only France saw a decline.
abstract: European Automobile Manufacturers' Assn reports new car sales rose 6.5 percent in October from year earlier to more than 1.07 million units; sales are again led by Spain, up 26.1 percent from October 2013, helped by government incentives; among major European markets, only France sees decline.
lead_paragraph: Sales were again led by Spain, up 26.1 percent from October 2013, helped by incentives. Among major European markets, only France saw a decline.

headline.main: Auto Sales in Europe Rise for 14th Consecutive Month
headline.print_headline: Auto Sales in Europe Rise for 14th Consecutive Month
